DataElement.preferredName: Needle Biopsy Invasive Prostate Carcinoma Neoplastic Core Proportion Fraction
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Proportion of total core length involved by invasive prostate carcinoma to total length of all needle biopsy cores.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Needle Biopsy Invasive Prostate Carcinoma Tumor Tissue Fraction
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Removal and examination of tissue obtained through a transdermal needle inserted into the specific region, organ, or tissue being analyzed.:definition pending_definition pending:A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A part, a fragment of a whole.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Removal and examination of tissue obtained through a transdermal needle inserted into the specific region, organ, or tissue being analyzed.:definition pending

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle, for microscopic examination.
A carcinoma that is not confined to the prostatic epithelium but has spread to the surrounding stroma of the prostate gland.  The vast majority of invasive prostate carcinomas are adenocarcinomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: definition pending:Fraction; a small part or item forming a piece of a whole.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.
A part, a fragment of a whole.
